de.bwvaachen.beamoflightgame.i18n

Class I18N

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.bwvaachen.beamoflightgame.i18n.I18N

  • public final class I18N
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Marius I18N allows converting strings to localized strings. This API is modeled to be similar to use like the GNU gettext utility. To use this class, just type @code{import static de.bwvaachen.beamoflightgame.i18n.I18N.*} before your class definition.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      I18N() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String _(java.lang.String ID)
      The _ function returns the localized form of the string ID
      static java.lang.String _f(java.lang.String ID, java.lang.Object... o)
      The _f function returns the localized formatted form of the string ID
      static java.lang.String _p(java.lang.String ID, int n)
      The _p function returns the localized form of the string ID.
      static java.lang.String _pf(java.lang.String ID, int n, java.lang.Object... o)
      The _pf function returns the localized formatted form of the string ID.

      • _p

        public static java.lang.String _p(java.lang.String ID,
                  int n)
        The _p function returns the localized form of the string ID. unless the _ function it will return the plural form if n is either 1 or -1.
        Parameters:
        the - string ID
        the - number
        Returns:
        the localized string

      • _f

        public static java.lang.String _f(java.lang.String ID,

        The _f function returns the localized formatted form of the string ID
        Parameters:
        the - string ID
        the - arguments for String.format
        Returns:
        the localized string

      • _pf

        public static java.lang.String _pf(java.lang.String ID,
                   int n,
                   java.lang.Object... o)
        The _pf function returns the localized formatted form of the string ID. unless the _f function it will return the plural form if n is either 1 or -1.
        Parameters:
        the - string ID
        the - number
        the - arguments for String.format
        Returns:
        the localized string
